alert.note: Alert for South Washington Cascade Foothills (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 11 at 3:16PM PST until January 14 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 1500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT FOR ELEVATIONS BELOW 1500 FEET.... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 1500 feet, snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 12 inches, highest above 2000-2500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph near the mouth of the Columbia River Gorge Friday night through Saturday. For the Winter Storm Watch below 1500 feet, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 65 mph near the mouth of the Columbia River Gorge. * WHERE...South Washington Cascade Foothills. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 AM PST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Friday afternoon through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause tree damage. Cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For elevations below 1500 feet, snow will likely begin Friday evening but will likely not accumulate on surfaces until later Friday night. Freezing rain is no longer expected in the south Washington Cascades and south Washington Cascade foothills. Uncertainty remains high regarding exact snow amounts below 1500 feet Friday night through Saturday night.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
